summary: Federal agencies must treat research animals humanely in their quest to answer scientific questions. As a check on their practices, the agencies must submit data about their animal use to the Animal and Plant Health Inspection Service (APHIS) and the National Institutes of Health. Concerned members of the public seek data on animal use to help ensure humane treatment. We found that agencies publicly report...
title: Animal Use in Federal Research: Agencies Share Information, but Reporting and Data Quality Could Be Strengthened
